snippet: John D. Apel had been barred from an Air Force base after convictions for vandalism and trespass, but he said those orders should not apply to an area open to the public on the other side of a green line.
abstract: Supreme Court dismisses First Amendment arguments from John D Apel, man convicted of breaking federal law by entering area set aside for protests near entrance to California Air Force Base after being banned from premises; justices instead focus on more narrow statutory questions.
lead_paragraph: John D. Apel had been barred from an Air Force base after convictions for vandalism and trespass, but he said those orders should not apply to an area open to the public on the other side of a green line.

headline.main: Dismissing Free Speech Claims, Justices Turn to Plain Line-Drawing
headline.print_headline: Dismissing Speech Claims, Justices Turn to Plain Line-Drawing
